A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
Even with the polarized fan base I found this one of the most refreshing movies of the Star Wars universe. I think we have all tried to "guess" where the story was going\, and sometimes we are disappointed because where it goes\, confuses us. 
Most of what I saw was just what we needed\, not just what we have seen before. There are so many arguments as to how or why such and such happens\, but in reality we are all interjecting our own hopes into what we wanted. 
Lucas started with a space opera that we all have brought in to our families\, and have nurtured as our own\, and as one who has seen all of these in the theatres\, when they originally came out\, there are many things that I have agreed with\, and some that I thought were poor choices. 
We are making judgments without being able to see the big picture that they are working toward\, and we may not like that picture when we do see it in the end\, but our own preference cannot change the fact that this could be one of the best movies in this series or not.
We love to shove our opinions through the "plot holes" we perceive\, but what we see as a hole\, may be our own lack of perception.  
Like it or hate it if you want\, I loved being surprised by a refreshing change\, and a look at the real heart of the Jedi. Yoga was right....
